DOC.criteria: Aged ≥ 18 year Signature inform consent Patients angina clinical indication coronary revascularisation drugeluting stent Presence least 2 lesion revascularised similar angiographic characteristic Reference lesion diameter difference 0.5 mm Maximum difference lesion length 10 mm Lesions able treat 1 stent Lesions due restenosis Lesions saphenous vein graft STEACS ( ST elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome ) Cardiogenic shock Dual antiplatelet therapy contraindication > 3 month Followup catheterisation contraindicate Chronic kidney failure creatinine > 2 mg/dL Allergy iodinate contrast agent Serious complication vascular access previous catheterisation Ineligible evaluation via optical coherence tomography Lesion locate < 5 mm aortoostial junction Severe proximal angulation > 90º Bifurcation lesion require strategy two stent Angiographic characteristic promote stent malposition Aneurysm coronary artery ectasia Presence thrombus class TIMI ( Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction ) 2 flow high Severe calcification , particular case calcium spike Severe lesion angulation Inability reliable followup , investigator 's opinion
